intro: Neoalsomitra trifoliolata, commonly known as the three-leaf palaquio, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets. The plant produces small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
